summary: This is an email chain from November 12, 2019, regarding Deutsche Bank's internal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's accounts. The bank plans to contact former employees, including Paul Morris, for interviews. The email is between bank personnel and external recipients, coordinating the investigation outreach.

persons.name: Parvin Moyne
persons.context: Appears to be a Deutsche Bank employee leading or coordinating the internal investigation into Epstein's accounts, planning to reach out to former employees.

persons.name: Thomas Moyer
persons.context: Copied on the email chain regarding the bank's internal investigation into Epstein's accounts.

persons.name: Joseph DiPiero
persons.context: Copied on the email chain regarding the bank's internal investigation into Epstein's accounts.

persons.name: Paul Morris
persons.context: Identified as a former Deutsche Bank employee whom the bank plans to contact as part of its internal investigation into Epstein's accounts.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the bank's internal investigation regarding his accounts at Deutsche Bank.

connections.description: Moyne, on behalf of Deutsche Bank's internal investigation, is planning to reach out to former employee Morris for an interview about Epstein's accounts.
Colleagues or professional contacts communicating about the bank's internal investigation procedures.
Colleagues or professional contacts communicating about the bank's internal investigation procedures.
Morris, as a former bank employee, had professional dealings with Epstein's accounts, making him a person of interest in the bank's investigation.

events.title: Deutsche Bank Internal Investigation Coordination
events.description: Deutsche Bank personnel coordinate via email about reaching out to former employees, including Paul Morris, as part of the bank's internal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's accounts.

keyFacts: Deutsche Bank was conducting an internal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's accounts as of November 2019.
The bank planned to interview former employees, specifically naming Paul Morris, as part of this investigation.
The email chain shows coordination between bank personnel (Parvin Moyne) and external parties regarding this investigative step.
The communication is marked as external and confidential, indicating sensitive internal deliberations about the Epstein case.
